Sentencas: The introduction of promising energy sources to satisfy human desires is extremely crucial.
Titulo: Performance evaluation of a novel fuel cell and wind-powered multigeneration system

Sentencas: The present work studies the performance of an original solid oxide fuel cell-wind-based polygeneration system for producing hydrogen, sodium hypochlorite, potable water, heating, cooling, and electrical power.
Titulo: Performance evaluation of a novel fuel cell and wind-powered multigeneration system

Sentencas: In the methodological concept, energy, exergy, economic, and exergoenvironmental assessments are carried out to evaluate the system performance concerning different parameters.
Titulo: Performance evaluation of a novel fuel cell and wind-powered multigeneration system

Sentencas: The technical outcomes depict that the system can produce 363 kW of electrical power, 162 kW of cooling, and 46.5 kW of heating at the design operating settings while the energy and exergy efficiencies are 55.5% and 38.1%, respectively.
Titulo: Performance evaluation of a novel fuel cell and wind-powered multigeneration system

Sentencas: Moreover, over a year of operation, the system can provide 19.9 x 10(-4) m(3) gaseous hydrogen, 50.9 x 10(3) m(3) potable water, and 5.31 tonnes of sodium hypochlorite to increase the gained benefits from this efficient and cost-effective system.
Titulo: Performance evaluation of a novel fuel cell and wind-powered multigeneration system

Sentencas: To evaluate the prevalence of the designed system, the economic outcomes demonstrate that the payback period is 1.5 years while the internal rate of return is 0.70.
Titulo: Performance evaluation of a novel fuel cell and wind-powered multigeneration system

Sentencas: Moreover, the system presents relatively proper environmental benefits based on the obtained outcomes from the exergoenvironmental study; the exergoenvironmental factor, exergy stability factor, and sustainability index are 0.50, 0.56, and 1.6, respectively.
Titulo: Performance evaluation of a novel fuel cell and wind-powered multigeneration system
